recipe_card: Tasty Low-Carb Egg and Vegetable Saute
recipe_name: Tasty Low-Carb Egg and Vegetable Saute
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vegetable oil, or as needed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 stalks asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  shallot, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼  green bell pepper, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼  Chinese okra, peeled and cut crosswise into chunks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  grape tomatoes, halved"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon garlic powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon ground white pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon chile powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon ground cumin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  eggs, beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 leaves Thai basil, or to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Heat oil in a saute pan over medium-high heat. Saute asparagus, shallot, green pepper, and Chinese okra until shallot is translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Add tomatoes, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, white pepper, chile powder, and cumin. Cook and stir until spices smell toasted, 1 to 2 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour eggs into the pan; cook until edges start to dry, about 2 minutes. Flip mixture over and cook until set, 2 to 3 minutes more. Transfer to a plate and sprinkle Thai basil on top."}]

recipe_card: Egg Flipped Over 45 Ratings

recipe_card: Easy Instant Pot Vegan Low-Carb Spaghetti Squash with Mushroom Ragu
recipe_name: Easy Instant Pot Vegan Low-Carb Spaghetti Squash with Mushroom Ragu
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (3 pound) spaghetti squash, halved and seeded"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup vegetable broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 sprig fresh rosemary"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ tablespoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  onion, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cloves garlic, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup chopped button mushrooms"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (28 ounce) can no-salt-added whole tomatoes, undrained and chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon dried sage"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  bay leaves"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon basil"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Combine spaghetti squash, vegetable broth, rosemary, and salt in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 7 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build."},{"recipe_directions":"Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove lid. Remove spaghetti squash and cool until easily handled. Scrape insides of squash into spaghetti strands with a fork."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; stir in onion and garlic. Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 4 minutes. Add mushrooms; cook until tender, about 3 minutes. Pour in peeled tomatoes and season with salt, black pepper, sage, and bay leaves. Cook over medium-high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, about 20 minutes. Remove bay leaves and stir in basil. Serve over spaghetti squash."}]

recipe_card: Instant Pot® Spinach and Mushroom Frittata

recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ½ cups baby bella mushrooms, stemmed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup finely chopped onion"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cloves garlic, finely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 large eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups chopped fresh spinach"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon garlic powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  serving cooking spray"}]

Clean the inside of the pot when it is cool enough to handle."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk eggs and heavy cream together in a medium bowl. Stir in spinach, Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, and garlic powder until well blended. Add the mushroom mixture and stir until well combined."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour 1 cup water into the pot and place a steamer rack trivet in the bottom."},{"recipe_directions":"Spray a souffle dish or other heat-proof dish with nonstick cooking spray. Stop filling about 1 1/4 inches from the funnel end and slip the casing off the funnel, smoothing out any bumps carefully with your fingers and being careful not to push the stuffing out of the casing. Tie off the open end of the sausage tightly with a piece of string or make a knot in the casing itself."},{"recipe_directions":"To cook, slice the sausage into half-inch rounds and grill in a hot skillet with no water for about 12 minutes on each side, or until brown and crisp at the edges."}]
